title: An unknown Directx Error has occurred...
body:
OK so i keep getting this message whenever i try to join a game: An unknown Directx error has occurred and League of Legends cannot start. Please make sure your video card is using the latest video drivers from the manufacturer.
I have tried literally every solution out there on the internet and nothing has worked. All of my drivers are up to date. I have pretty much given up due to nothing working so i was wondering if anyone had any other suggestions that isn't already in other threads. I have deleted tons of files and uninstalled several times and reset my computer. Getting to the point that I'm just going to quit the game because this is ridiculous.

replies.body:
What GPU, OS, drivers, other hardware?

Can you get far enough into the game client to start a repair, and have you tried downloading the installer and running it again?

AMD fx(tm)-4300 quad, Windows 10, amd radeon r7 200 series. other hardware nothing really extra on here. yes i have done several repairs. i can log on to the client and try to spectate or start a game and it pops up right after i try. i have uninstalled the game and reinstalled as well

Have you tried the low-spec mods, and otherwise disabling as many settings as possible? You could also try editing or deleting the graphics config file (it may be a specific setting incompatible with your rather old hardware).

This file (assuming you installed LoL to the root of C: in windows)  C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config\game.cfg

Open game.cfg in administrator mode notepad and lower settings, or simply move/rename the file and test the client. If it works, just reconfigure your settings. If it crashes and burns horribly, move the file back and try something else.
